TITLE: Basic Variable Output in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic syntax for outputting a variable in Edge templates. This example shows how to display a user's username using double curly braces for variable interpolation. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/introduction.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` Hello {{ user.username }}! ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Edge.js Server Setup DESCRIPTION: Example of setting up Edge.js with Node.js HTTP server, including template mounting and rendering SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/getting_started.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { Edge } from 'edge.js' import { createServer } from 'node:http' const edge = Edge.create() edge.mount(new URL('./views', import.meta.url)) const server = createServer(async (req, res) => { const data = { username: 'virk' } const html = await edge.render('home', data) res.setHeader('content-type', 'text/html') res.end(html) }) server.listen(3000) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Global State in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Example of setting global state using edge.global() method to share config data across all templates and components. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/templates_state.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` edge.global('config', { colorScheme: 'dark', menu: [], socialLinks: [], }) ``` LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ```
@each(item in config.menu) @end
@each(link in config.socialLinks) @end
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Conditional Rendering in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement conditional logic in Edge templates. This example checks if a user has a subscription and displays different messages based on the condition. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/introduction.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @if(user.hasSubscription) Hurray! You have access to over 280 videos. @else Videos are available only to subscribers. @end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: If-ElseIf-Else Condition in Edge DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a complete if-elseif-else conditional block for handling different user name display scenarios. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/conditionals.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @if(user.fullName)

Hello {{ user.fullName }}!

@elseif(user.firstName)

Hello {{ user.firstName }}!

@else

Hello Guest!

@end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Basic Button Component in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates creating a simple button component with customizable type and text properties. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/components/introduction.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Async/Await Support in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates Edge's support for asynchronous operations using async/await. This example fetches user payments asynchronously and displays the count of payments made. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/introduction.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @let(payments = await user.getPayments()) You have made {{ payments.length }} payments so far. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Edge.js Disk Mounting DESCRIPTION: Examples of mounting single and multiple template directories SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/getting_started.md#2025-04-19_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` const BASE_URL = new URL('./', import.meta.url) edge.mount(new URL('views', BASE_URL)) await edge.render('home') await edge.render('pages/posts/index') ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` const BASE_URL = new URL('./', import.meta.url) edge.mount( 'elegant', new URL('themes/elegant', BASE_URL) ) edge.mount( 'classic', new URL('themes/classic', BASE_URL) ) edge.mount( 'mono', new URL('themes/mono', BASE_URL) ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Local State in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create isolated renderer instances with separate local state using edge.createRenderer() and share() method. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/templates_state.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` const templ1 = edge.createRenderer() const templ2 = edge.createRenderer() templ1.share({ url: '/posts', }) templ2.share({ url: '/posts/1', }) await templ1.renderRaw('{{ url }}') // /posts await templ2.renderRaw('{{ url }}') // /posts/1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Edge.js Components in Templates DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use components within templates using the @component tag with props. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/components/introduction.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ```
@!component('components/button', { text: 'Login' }) @!component('components/button', { text: 'Cancel', type: 'reset' })
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Edge Template DESCRIPTION: Example of a basic Edge.js template file with variable interpolation SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/getting_started.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ```

Hello {{ username }}

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Merge Props with Button Component DESCRIPTION: Example of merging props with default values in a button component and its rendered output. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/templates_state.md#2025-04-19_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @let(config = await loadConfig()) {{ config.someKey }} ``` LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` {{-- Define variable --}} @let(total = 0)

  • {{ item.name }} = {{ item.price }}

SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/templates_state.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` edge.global('findUser', async function (id) { return User.findById(id) }) ``` LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @let(user = await findUser(1)) {{ user.username }} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Interpolation in EdgeJS DESCRIPTION: Shows basic usage of interpolation with double curly braces for embedding JavaScript expressions in Edge templates. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/interpolation.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` Hello {{ username }}! ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Examples of Invalid and Valid @if Tag Syntax DESCRIPTION: Compares invalid and valid syntax for the @if tag in Edge templates. Shows the importance of proper formatting and syntax requirements for Edge tags. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/syntax_specification.md#2025-04-19_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @if ( username ) ``` LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @if(username) ``` LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @if(username) Hello @endif ``` LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @if(username) Hello @end ``` LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @if( username )

      Hello

    • {{ user.username }}
      • @end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Loops with Fallback Content using @else in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Shows how to provide fallback content when looping over empty arrays or undefined values. The @else tag defines content that displays only when the collection has no items to iterate over. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/loops.md#2025-04-19_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @each(comment in post.comments) @include('partials/comment') @else

      This post has not received any comments

      @end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JavaScript Expression Examples in EdgeJS DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates various JavaScript expressions that can be used within interpolation blocks, including property access, method calls, arithmetic, and async expressions. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/interpolation.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` {{ user.username }} {{ user.username.toUpperCase() }} {{ (2 + 2) * 3 }} {{ (await getUser()).username }} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using a Component with Main Slot in Edge DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use the card component with a main slot. The component title is passed as a prop, while the content is defined between the opening and closing tags. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/components/slots.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @card({ title: 'Quick start' })

      Start building your next project in minutes

      @end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Layout Template with Slots in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a layout file that uses slots to receive content from other templates. It defines a basic HTML structure with slots for meta content and main content, and uses a title variable with a default value. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/components/layouts.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` // title: views/components/layout/app.edge {{ title || "Your default title" }} @if ($slots.meta) {{{ await $slots.meta() }}} @endif {{{ await $slots.main() }}} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic If Condition in Edge DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement a basic if condition to conditionally render user information. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/conditionals.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @unless(account.isActive)

      Please verify your email address to activate the account

      @end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Map Component with Markers in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Example showing the desired API implementation for a map component with multiple markers using Edge.js templating syntax SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/components/provide_inject.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @map({ center: [-84, 35], zoom: 3 }) @!map.marker({ lat: 37.8225, lon: -122.0024, label: 'Edge Body Shaping' }) @!map.marker({ lat: 33.8981, lon: -118.4169, label: 'Edge Barbershop & Essentials' }) @!map.marker({ lat: 29.723, lon: -95.4189, label: 'Edge Waxing Studio' }) @!map.marker({ lat: 28.3378, lon: -81.3966, label: 'Edge 30 Nutritional Consultants' }) @!map.marker({ lat: 40.6483, lon: -74.0237, label: 'Edge Brands LLC' }) @end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Context in Edge.js Components DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to access shared context within child components SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/components/provide_inject.md#2025-04-19_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @map() {{ inspect($context) }} @end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Array Iteration with Index Access in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Shows how to access both the element and its index when looping through arrays with the @each tag. The index can be used for numbering or conditional logic based on position. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/loops.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @each((user, index) in users)
    • {{ index + 1 }} {{ user.username }}
      • @end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Ternary Operator in Edge DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use inline conditional ternary operator for dynamic class assignment. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/conditionals.md#2025-04-19_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Main Map Component Implementation in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Core map component implementation that shares state with child components and renders the map container using Alpine.js SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/components/provide_inject.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @let(map = { center, zoom, markers: [], }) @inject({ map }) @eval(await $slots.main())
      ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Modal Component Definition in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Example of a modal component implementation with multiple named slots. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/components/introduction.md#2025-04-19_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ```
      {{{ await $slots.header() }}}

      {{{ await $slots.footer() }}}
      ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Object Iteration with Key-Value Access in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to iterate over a JavaScript object's key-value pairs. This syntax destructures each entry into its value and key, making both accessible within the loop. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/loops.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @each((amount, ingredient) in food)
    • Use {{ amount }} of {{ ingredient }}
      • @end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Edge.js Cache Configuration DESCRIPTION: Example of enabling template caching in production environment SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/getting_started.md#2025-04-19_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const edge = Edge.create({ cache: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production' }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Optional Chaining and Default Values in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Shows how Edge supports JavaScript expressions including optional chaining and logical OR for default values. This example displays the user's subscription plan or falls back to 'Not subscribed' if no plan exists. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/introduction.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` {{ user.subscription?.plan || 'Not subscribed' }} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining a Card Component with Named Slots in Edge DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a card component with named slots for header and content. It uses the $slots object to access and render the slot content. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/components/slots.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @let(attributes = $props .merge({ class: ['card'] }) .toAttrs() )
      {{{ await $slots.header() }}}
      {{{ await $slots.content() }}}
      ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Edge.js In-Memory Template Registration DESCRIPTION: Example of registering and using in-memory templates SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/getting_started.md#2025-04-19_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` edge.registerTemplate('uikit.button', { template: `` }) ``` LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @!component('uikit.button', { text: 'Submit', type: 'submit', class: ['btn', 'btn-primary'], disabled: false, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Component State in Slots in Edge DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to access component state that was passed to a slot. It captures the passed state in a variable named componentState and uses it within the slot content. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/components/slots.md#2025-04-19_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @card() @slot('header') Quick start @end @slot('content', componentState)

      I am a {{ componentState.cardSize }} card

      @end @end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Stack in Edge.js Layout Template DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a named stack using the @stack tag in an Edge.js layout template. The stack is placed in the head section for JavaScript content. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/stacks.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` // highlight-start @stack('js') // highlight-end
      @!dialog()
      ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Including Basic Partials in Edge.js Templates DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to include header and footer partials within a main template using the @include directive. The code shows the basic structure of including reusable template fragments. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/partials.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @include('partials/header')
      The main content goes here
      @include('partials/footer') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Debugging Edge.js Templates with Inspect Helper DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the 'inspect' helper in Edge.js to prettyprint a complex object structure. It includes various data types such as arrays, objects, BigInt, Symbol, Set, Map, WeakSet, WeakMap, and Date. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/debugging.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` {{ inspect({ a: 1, b: [3, 4, undefined, null], c: undefined, d: null, e: { regex: /^x/i, buf: Buffer.from('abc'), }, balance: BigInt(100), id: Symbol('1234'), scores: new Set([1, 2, 3]), classes: new Map([['english', '1st'], ['maths', '2nd']]), currentScores: new WeakSet([[1, 2, 3]]), currentClasses: new WeakMap([[['english', '1st'], ['maths', '2nd']]]), now: new Date() }) }} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Template Rendering in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Example of basic template rendering with shared data and direct render method. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/templates_state.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` const view = edge.createRenderer().share({ url: req.url }) await view.render('template-path') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using truncate Helper in Edge Templates DESCRIPTION: Shows various ways to use the truncate helper for shortening strings, including options for complete words and custom suffixes. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/digging_deeper/helpers.md#2025-04-19_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` {{\n truncate(\n 'This is a very long sentence that i would like to be shortened',\n 18\n )\n}} ``` LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` {{\n truncate(\n 'This is a very long sentence that i would like to be shortened',\n 18,\n { completeWords: false }\n )\n}} ``` LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` {{\n truncate(\n 'This is a very long sentence that i would like to be shortened',\n 18,\n { suffix: ' [Read more]' }\n )\n}} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using a Layout with Slots in an Edge.js Template DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use a layout with slots in a welcome page template. It passes a title to the layout and fills both the meta and main slots with specific content, demonstrating how slots can be used to replace sections of a layout. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/components/layouts.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` // title: views/welcome.edge @layout.app({ title: "Welcome page title" }) @slot('meta') @endslot @slot('main')

      Hello world

      @endslot @end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using inspect Helper in Edge Templates DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the inspect helper for debugging by pretty-printing complex JavaScript objects, including various data types and structures. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/digging_deeper/helpers.md#2025-04-19_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` {{\n inspect({\n a: 1,\n b: [3, 4, undefined, null],\n c: undefined,\n d: null,\n e: {\n regex: /^x/i,\n buf: Buffer.from('abc'),\n },\n balance: BigInt(100),\n id: Symbol('1234'),\n scores: new Set([1, 2, 3]),\n classes: new Map([['english', '1st'], ['maths', '2nd']]),\n currentScores: new WeakSet([[1, 2, 3]]),\n currentClasses: new WeakMap([[['english', '1st'], ['maths', '2nd']]]),\n now: new Date()\n })\n}} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Case Transformation Helpers in Edge Templates DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates various case transformation helpers available in Edge templates for converting string cases. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/digging_deeper/helpers.md#2025-04-19_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` {{ camelCase('hello-world') }} // Output: helloWorld\n{{ snakeCase('hello-world') }} // Output: hello_world\n{{ dashCase('HelloWorld') }} // Output: hello-world\n{{ pascalCase('hello-world') }} // Output: HelloWorld\n{{ capitalCase('hello-world') }} // Output: Hello-World\n{{ sentenceCase('hello-world') }} // Output: Hello world\n{{ dotCase('hello-world') }} // Output: hello.world\n{{ noCase('hello-world') }} // Output: hello world\n{{ titleCase('hello-world') }} // Output: Hello-World ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using html.attrs with Class Attribute in Edge Templates DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the html.attrs helper with the class attribute, which can accept a string, array of strings, or an object for conditional classes. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/digging_deeper/helpers.md#2025-04-19_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Modal Component with Slots DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the modal component with multiple named slots. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/components/introduction.md#2025-04-19_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @modal() @slot('header')

      Delete post

      @end @slot('content')

      You are about to delete the post permanently

      @end @slot('footer') @end @end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Map Marker Component Implementation in Edge.js DESCRIPTION: Marker component that validates context and adds marker data to the parent map component's state SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/components/provide_inject.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @if(!$context.map) @newError( 'The map.marker component should be nested within the map component', $caller.filename, $caller.line, $caller.col ) @end @eval($context.map.markers.push({ lat, lon, label })) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Block-level Tag Example in Edge DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a block-level tag (@if) which has an opening and closing statement with content inside. Block-level tags require proper opening and closing syntax. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/syntax_specification.md#2025-04-19_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @if(someCondition) If block content @end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Escaping in Edge Template DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how Edge automatically escapes HTML content in expressions, converting HTML tags to their escaped equivalents to prevent XSS attacks. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/syntax_specification.md#2025-04-19_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` {{ 'This should be red.' }} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Component Passing Data to Slots in Edge DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to pass data from a component to its slots. The component passes sizes and cardSize objects to both header and content slots when rendering them. SOURCE: https://github.com/edge-js/edgejs.dev/blob/main/content/docs/components/slots.md#2025-04-19_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: edge CODE: ``` @let(cardSize = 'medium') @let(sizes = { medium: '350px', small: '200px', large: '450px' })
      {{{ await $slots.header({ sizes, cardSize }) }}}
      {{{ await $slots.content({ sizes, cardSize }) }}}
      ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inline Tag Example in Edge DESCRIPTION: Shows an inline tag (@include) which doesn't accept a body and doesn't need to be explicitly closed.
